home.title: SETI Solo Helper
home.play1: Play a SETI solo game against a rival research institution.
home.play2: This application replaces the rival action cards and player board and guides you through the game and solo ruleset. It supports all difficult levels and the Space Agencies expansion.

setupGame.title: Setup Game
setupGame.setup2Players: Set up the game for two players.
setupGame.setup2PlayersRound2: Set up the game for two players (starting with round 2).
setupGame.playerScoreTrackSetup: Place your score counter on space {space} of the score track.
setupGame.rivalPieces: Give the rival all pieces of one color.
setupGame.componentsNotRequired: He does not need the action cards, player board, score counter or publicity marker.
setupGame.objectiveStack: The objective stack is managed by the application.
setupGame.chooseOrganizationQuickstartCards: Choose your organization and quick start cards.
setupGame.rivalNoOrganizationQuickstartCards: The rival does not get an organization or quick start cards.

ruleChanges.title: Rule Changes
ruleChanges.resources: Resources: Your rival does not keep track of resources. Instead, whenever an effect on the game board gives your rival resources, enter them in the application at the end of each turn. The application automatically manages the rival's progress. Direct effects from rival actions are managed by the application automatically, do not enter them in the input fields.
ruleChanges.objectives: Objectives: Mark the tasks in the application once you have completed them. If a single trigger could mark multiple tasks (even on different objectives), you must choose only one.

roundTurnPlayer.passConfirm: Pass and drop out of the action phase?

notPossibleConfirm.title: Skip Action
notPossibleConfirm.confirm: Please confirm to skip this action and discard the entered resource values.

roundTurnBot.discardEndOfRoundCard: Remove the top card from the end-of-round stack.
roundTurnBot.pleaseSelectTech: Please select the type of the chosen tech.

roundEnd.title: End of Round

objectives.title: You need to discard {count} completed objective, if possible. | You need to discard {count} completed objectives, if possible.
objectives.numberCompleted: You completed {count} objective. | You completed {count} objectives.
objectives.discardObjectives: You discard {count} completed objective. | You discard {count} completed objectives.

roundEnd.longTermObjectives: You have {count} uncompleted task on long-term objectives. | You have {count} uncompleted tasks on long-term objectives.

gameStatus.title: Game Status
gameStatus.exterianRivalCards: At the end of the game, all rival Exertian cards are considered successfully completed, and the rival scores full points for them.

botResources.gainThisTurn: Rival gains this turn from the game board:

lifeTrace.title: Life Traces
lifeTrace.mark: Whenever your rival earns a life trace, look at that column for each alien species. Your rival marks the lowest available space in that column. (They ignore the overflow space below the column, unless all other spaces are full.)
lifeTrace.any: With this symbol, the rival considers all available columns.
lifeTrace.tiebreaker: If the spaces in the selected columns are equally low, choose the leftmost or rightmost, depending on the decision arrow.
lifeTrace.oumuamua: They mark the space that requires payment of exofossils only when they have enough of them; otherwise, they consider the space occupied.
lifeTrace.centaurians: The rival marks spaces that require payment of data only if they have a full computer and enough leftover data to pay (min. 6 data plus the data cost). Enter the data cost as negative value.
lifeTrace.arkhos:
The only way the rival breaches their security cards is when the corresponding action is shown. Ignore Arkhos board spaces the rival cannot access yet.
When choosing between spaces on the same level, the rival prefers Arkhos spaces over other species.
lifeTrace.glyphids: If any of the top spaces on this species board is empty (no token to take), the rival ignores it.
lifeTrace.amoeba: When selecting spaces to mark, the rival ignores Amoeba spaces with 1 or 0 organelle bonuses.

exofossil.title: Exofossils
exofossil.collect: The rival also collects exofossil tokens.

botReachedMilestones.neutral: The rival reached a neutral milestone on score {score}.
botReachedMilestones.gold:
The rival reached a gold milestone on score {score}.
He claims the first, most valuable free spot on a gold tile.
botReachedMilestones.centaurians: Centaurians: When the rival reaches their message milestone, they choose the leftmost or rightmost available reward, according to the decision arrow.

speciesDiscovery.title: Discover Species
speciesDiscovery.alreadyDiscovered: Please select the species already discovered:

tech.title: Tech
tech.rotateSolarSystems: Whenever the rival gains a tech, advance the solar system as usual.
tech.chooseTech: The rival chooses what technology to research in the following manner:
tech.preferredTechs: The rival prefers techs in the displayed order.
tech.twoPointTile: If there is a tech with a 2-point tile on it, it prefers that before all others within that order.
tech.getBonus:
Give the rival whatever bonuses are shown on the tech tile it took, including the 2-point bonus if the tech had one.
Exception: The rival will never get launch or 2 data bonuses from techs.
tech.discard: Discard the tech, the application manages it automatically.

launch.title: Launch
launch.placeProbe: Place a rival probe figure on Earth.

probe.title: Orbiter/Lander
probe.moveProbe: Move the rival's probe from Earth to a planet. Check the planets in order from left to right, until you find one which you can reach in the depicted number of moves. As usual, the rival needs to pay 1 extra move to leave asteroids, so take that into account when deciding what is reachable.
probe.publicity: After moving, give the rival the publicity earned for visiting planets and comets. If there are multiple ways to fly to that planet using the moves provided, choose the flight plan that gives the most publicity.
probe.landOrbit: Finally, the probe becomes a lander or an orbiter:
probe.landMoon: If the planet has a moon with an available space, rival will land on it. If multiple moons are available, the rival chooses the leftmost or rightmost, depending on the decision arrow.
probe.preferOrbitLand: The rival tries to take the first orbiter space or the first lander space on the planet. If both first spaces are available, or if neither is, the rival defers to the displayed action order.
probe.pointsResources: Either way, give the rival any points, resources, and life traces earned from the orbiter or lander.

telescope.title: Telescope
telescope.markSignals: Mark your rival's signals as shown by the action. For signals from the card row, use the decision arrow to determine whether the leftmost or rightmost cards will be chosen.
telescope.redrawCards: After the rival has finished marking signals from the card row, replace the discarded cards with new cards from the top of the deck.

multipleSectors.title: If a signal could be marked in multiple different sectors, the rival chooses a sector for their signal based on the following logic:
multipleSectors.sectorWin: If by marking the signal the rival would win a sector, the rival chooses that sector.
multipleSectors.scorePoints: If no such sector can be won, the rival instead checks to see if marking a signal can score points for marking the second signal in a sector.
multipleSectors.mostMarkers: If no sector can be won or score points, the rival chooses the sector where they have the most markers.
multipleSectors.tieBreaker: For each of these steps, in the event of a tie, the rival favors the bigger sector (the sector that can contain the most data).

analyze.title: Analyze
analyze.lifeTrace: The rival marks the displayed life trace.

speciesDiscovery.title: Species Discovery
speciesDiscovery.instructions: If alien species #{alienSpeciesIndex} is already discovered, please mark this in the application by using the button Discover on the right side. Follow the replaced species action then instead.

mascamites.title: Mascamites Special Action
mascamites.instructions: Take a random sample token from the planet and place it face up on this species board (ignore its reward).
mascamites.landPlanet: The rival lands on the planet.

anomalies.title: Anomalies Special Action
anomalies.instructions: If the rival is not winning the next anomaly, they mark 1 species trace of that color for this species.

centaurians.title: Centaurians Special Action
centaurians.instructions: If the rival still has a message milestone in his reserve and none on the scoring track, place one message milestone 15 points ahead of their current score.
centaurians.generalInstructions: When you discover this alien species, the rival places one message milestone token as a player would, and takes all leftover tokens. They get to use them with their alien action.

exertians.title: Exertians Special Action
exertians.instructions: Count the number of rival's played exertian cards and rival's alien traces on this species board. If the total is less than 5, the rival secretly plays a exertian card.
exertians.generalInstructions:
The rival can only draw and play Exertian cards via actions related to this species. They ignore the Exertian milestones.
When this species is discovered, the rival does not draw or play any cards, but they do advance on the progress track for each marker they placed on the discovery spaces.

arkhos.title: Arkhos Special Action
arkhos.instructions: The rival breaches one of their security cards at random and marks and overflow space below this species in the matching color (ignoring its reward - managed by the application).
arkhos.generalInstructions: When Arkhos is discovered, the rival gains minor exploration rewards for his contribution and 3 security cards.

amoeba.title: Amoeba Special Action
amoeba.instructions: If one of the sections on the Amoeba board has 3 organelle tokens, the rival gains all organelle bonuses in that section (and moves the tokens as usual).

action.abortGameConfirm: Aborting the running game - are you sure?
action.endGameConfirm: End this game and return to home screen - are you sure?

serviceWorkerUpdatedRefresh.title: Refresh Application
serviceWorkerUpdatedRefresh.notice: The application was updated - do you want to refresh to use the latest version?
